captions.text:
Hi guys! I'm Laura Vitale, and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to share with
you my little mini Oreo cheesecakes.

Now the reason I'm making this recipe is because
recently, I showed you a confetti birthday

cake and I asked you what your favorite cake
is and what you like to eat on your birthday,

for your birthday cake - and one of my really
sweet subscribers said that their birthday

is coming up and they really wanted me to
make some Oreo cheesecakes because that's
their favorite!
So, that's what we're making today.

They're really easy and simple to do, but
- I love Oreos, love cheesecake, and these

just couldn't be any easier. Let me take you
over the ingredients so we can get started!

You'll need some cream cheese that's been
softened at room temperature, granulated sugar,

some eggs, I've got some crushed up Oreos,
plus you will need a few more. A little sour

cream, some vanilla extract and I also have
a small little pinch of salt in with the sugar.

I have a twelve piece muffin tin back there
that I've sprayed with some non-stick cooking

spray and I put an Oreo in each one - and
then I also have my oven preheated to 350F
- we're ready to roll!
So easy and so simple!

In my standing mixer that I have fitted with
a paddle attachment, I'm going to add in my

cream cheese, and it's really important that
your cream cheese is softened at room temperature

because you don;t want any lumps of cream
cheese running through this, you want everything
to be really nice and smooth.

And I'm just going to give that a heads up
and let it mix for about 30 seconds, just

to kind of get it going before we add in our
remaining ingredients.

Going to add in my sour cream - and you need
a little sour cream, I think it makes the
biggest difference.

I'm also going to add in my eggs and my sugar,
pretty much everything else with a little

pinch of salt and some vanilla, now I"m going
to mix this together until everything is really

nice and creamy, and I am going to - I am
going to scrape down the sides of the bowl

every so often because I want everything to
be really creamy, I don't want any lumps here

and lumps there, I want it to be really well
combined.

And sometimes it's necessary to just scrape
down the sides of the bowl just a couple times
to ensure it all comes out good.

Just adding my Oreo crumbs - now that's really
an optional step if you - you don't really

have to add them in there because we do have
the, you know, Oreo base.

But, why stop at the base when you can add
some in?
That's my motto!
Ha!

I'm just going to scrape this off the paddle
attachment, I want to scrape off as much as
I can.

Get my bowl our, and then just give everything
a really good mix from the bottom.

An then just using an ice cream scoop, divide
your batter evenly.

These babies are going to go into the oven
at 350F for twenty minutes and then we are

going to let them cool on the counter until
they're about room temperature, pop them in

the fridge for a few hours or until they're
completely cold and chilled, and we'll be
ready to eat!

My little mini cheesecakes baked for 16 minutes,
they looked perfect to me around the 15 minute

mark, you want the top to just be set and
then you want to let them cool completely

on the counter before popping them in the
fridge for several hours to cool completely.

Now, you will see that they're lightly golden
around the edges - now, if you were to use

a muffin liner, you wouldn't get any sort
of dark around the edges, so that's really

up to you, I tend to not use a muffin liner
when I'm making mini cheesecakes, just because
I think they come out a little bit easier.

But, that's about it. And the thing I love
most about it is that the bottom, which is

the cookie, keeps its crunch, it doesn't get
all soggy, which I like - I like a little
bit of texture.
But, it gets slightly chewy.
That is gorgeous.
And creamy.
And delicious.

And everything that's good in the world is
in this little package.

I love this, finish it off with like a little
bit of a piece of Oreo cookie, or a whole

Oreo cookie on top so people can tell that
it's a mini Oreo cheesecake.
And that's it!
Super simple and easy to make, look how cute!

LauraintheKitchen.com will have the recipe
waiting for you, I hope you have enjoyed spending
time with me.

I'm so excited I can hardly take it anymore!
Ha!

I hope you have enjoyed spending time with
me guys, and I will see you next time!
Bye bye!

title: Mini Oreo Cheesecake Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 799
